trans-unit.source: Different ways to create a Linux virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Different ways to create a Linux virtual machine

trans-unit.source: Lists the different ways to create a Linux virtual machine and gives links to instructions.
trans-unit.target: Lists the different ways to create a Linux virtual machine and gives links to instructions.

trans-unit.source: Azure offers different ways to create a VM because VMs are suited for different users and purposes.
trans-unit.target: Azure offers different ways to create a VM because VMs are suited for different users and purposes.

trans-unit.source: This means you'll need to make some choices about the VM and how you'll create it.
trans-unit.target: This means you'll need to make some choices about the VM and how you'll create it.

trans-unit.source: This article gives you a summary of these choices and links to instructions.
trans-unit.target: This article gives you a summary of these choices and links to instructions.

trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager templates were recently introduced as a way to create and manage a virtual machine and its different resources as one logical deployment unit.
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager templates were recently introduced as a way to create and manage a virtual machine and its different resources as one logical deployment unit.

trans-unit.source: Instructions for this approach are included below, where available.
trans-unit.target: Instructions for this approach are included below, where available.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about Azure Resource Manager and how to manage resources as one unit, see the <linkText>overview</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To learn more about Azure Resource Manager and how to manage resources as one unit, see the <linkText>overview</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The graphical user interface of the Azure portal is an easy way to try out a virtual machine, especially if you're just starting out with Azure.
trans-unit.target: The graphical user interface of the Azure portal is an easy way to try out a virtual machine, especially if you're just starting out with Azure.

trans-unit.source: Use either the <linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title> or the <linkText>Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title> to create the VM.
trans-unit.target: Use either the <linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title> or the <linkText>Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title> to create the VM.

trans-unit.source: For general instructions, see Create a Custom Virtual Machine and select any Linux image from the Gallery.
trans-unit.target: For general instructions, see Create a Custom Virtual Machine and select any Linux image from the Gallery.

trans-unit.source: Note that the <linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title> creates virtual machines using only the classic deployment model.
trans-unit.target: Note that the <linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title> creates virtual machines using only the classic deployment model.

trans-unit.source: If you prefer working in a command shell, choose between the Azure command-line interface (CLI) for Mac and Linux users, or Azure PowerShell, which has Windows PowerShell cmdlets for Azure and a custom console.
trans-unit.target: If you prefer working in a command shell, choose between the Azure command-line interface (CLI) for Mac and Linux users, or Azure PowerShell, which has Windows PowerShell cmdlets for Azure and a custom console.

trans-unit.source: For Azure CLI, see <linkText>Create a Virtual Machine Running Linux</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For Azure CLI, see <linkText>Create a Virtual Machine Running Linux</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To use a template, see <linkText>Deploy and Manage Virtual Machines using Azure Resource Manager Templates and the Azure CLI</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To use a template, see <linkText>Deploy and Manage Virtual Machines using Azure Resource Manager Templates and the Azure CLI</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For Azure PowerShell, see <linkText>Use Azure PowerShell to create and preconfigure Linux-based Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For Azure PowerShell, see <linkText>Use Azure PowerShell to create and preconfigure Linux-based Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To use a template, see <linkText>Deploy and Manage Virtual Machines using Azure Resource Manager Templates and PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To use a template, see <linkText>Deploy and Manage Virtual Machines using Azure Resource Manager Templates and PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Creating a virtual machine for a website with Visual Studio</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Creating a virtual machine for a website with Visual Studio</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Deploy Azure Resources Using the Compute, Network, and Storage .NET Libraries</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Deploy Azure Resources Using the Compute, Network, and Storage .NET Libraries</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Choose an image based on the operating system you want to run.
trans-unit.target: Choose an image based on the operating system you want to run.

trans-unit.source: Azure and its partners offer many images, some of which include applications and tools.
trans-unit.target: Azure and its partners offer many images, some of which include applications and tools.

trans-unit.source: Or, use one of your own images.
trans-unit.target: Or, use one of your own images.

trans-unit.source: These instructions show you how to use an Azure image to create a virtual machine that's customized with options for networking, load balancing, and more.
trans-unit.target: These instructions show you how to use an Azure image to create a virtual machine that's customized with options for networking, load balancing, and more.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>How to Create a Custom Virtual Machine Running Linux in Azure</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>How to Create a Custom Virtual Machine Running Linux in Azure</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Use an image based on an existing Azure virtual machine by capturing that VM, or upload an image of your own, stored in a virtual hard disk (VHD):
trans-unit.target: Use an image based on an existing Azure virtual machine by capturing that VM, or upload an image of your own, stored in a virtual hard disk (VHD):
